This general induction will give you a brief on how to work safely in the Quito office
The risks and dangers associate with working in this environment
Some important ítems wich you have to comply with while working in the office
Inside the office, you can find the following information:
Evacuation plan, located at the office entrance
Map of the muster point, located at the office entrance
Safety brigade blackboard, located at the office entrance
Map of earthquake safe zones, first aid kit, fire extinguishers and alarms. Located at the office entrance
In case of fire, shout FIRE, FIRE, FIRE and actívate the nearest alarm

Follow the Safety Brigadier (Brigadiers have vests on their chairs for identification) and evacuate the offices and the building using the stairs, do not use the elevator (see the plan of emergency exits)
In a calm way, head towards the Ekopark muster point, located in front of Tower 2 (see the Ekopark evacuation plan)
Do not re-enter the building or offices until you have received an official authorization to do it
In the event of an earthquake or tremor keep calm and seek protection in a safe area such as a beam or column (see plan of safe areas)
Once the earthquake or tremor has passed, follow the safety brigadier and evacuate the offices and the building using the stairs, do not use the elevator (see the emergency exits plan)
In a calm way, head towards the meeting point of the Ekopark complex, located in front of Tower 2 (see the Ekopark evacuation plan)
Do not re-enter the building or offices until you have received authorization to do so
Always check your work area and verify that there are not loose cables
Do not leave your suitcases and/or belongings in the corridors where people may trip
If you are coming from another country please familiarize yourself with the Ecuador Travel Guide, it will inform you about your personal safety and crime
All accidents and incidents must be reported
Cerro Quebrado is committed to providing a safe working environment
